newsitem.title: USA: CBOE lists new securities linked to Japan stocks.
newsitem.headline: CBOE lists new securities linked to Japan stocks.

text.p: The Chicago Board Options Exchange (CBOE) said Friday it began trading a new structured equity product, Salomon Inc Nikkei 225 index securities due August 20, 2002.
Salomon Brothers, AG Edwards & Sons, Oppenheimer & Co and Prudential Securities underwrote the offering of 6.5 million notes at $10 each.
By late morning, total volume was 70,800 and the notes were trading at 10. They were also available at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE).

Benjamin Krause, CBOE senior vice president of the capital markets division, said the new securities would allow investors the chance to participate in price appreciation of the Japanese benchmark stock index, the Nikkei 225.

At maturity, holders of NXS will receive the principal amount and a "supplemental redemption amount" that will be based on the percentage increase, if any, in the Nikkei 225 index over the starting index value of 19,326.03, the index's closing level Friday.
The supplemental redemption amount will not be less than zero. No interest is paid on the securities, which are not redeemable or callable prior to maturity.
Kessler Asher Securities Trading LP is the designated primary market maker (DPM) in the NXS securities.
